params.owner: Address for whom to query the balance

constructor.details: Creates a new ZKP SBT, inheriting from the SBT contract.

returns._0: The encrypted data with the public key of the owner of the SBT
The root of the Merkle Tree's data without encryption, used to verify the data

params.owner: Address for whom to check the ownership

returns._0: True if `owner` has a valid token, false otherwise
True if the token is valid, false otherwise

mint(address,bytes,bytes[]).details: The caller must have the MINTER role

params.root: Root of the Merkle Tree's data without encryption, used to verify the data
params.to: The address to mint the SBT to

returns._0: The SBT ID of the newly minted SBT
Descriptive name of the tokens in this contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setVerifier(address).details: The caller must have the OWNER role

returns._0: An abbreviated name of the tokens in this contract

params.owner: Address for whom to get the token

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

Minted(address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when a token `tokenId` is minted for `owner`

Revoked(address,uint256).notice: Event emitted when token `tokenId` of `owner` is revoked

balanceOf(address).notice: Count all tokens assigned to an owner

getEncryptedData(uint256).notice: Returns the encrypted data with the public key of the owner of the SBT

getRoot(uint256).notice: Returns the root of the Merkle Tree's data without encryption, used to verify the data

hasValid(address).notice: Check if an address owns a valid token in the contract

isValid(uint256).notice: Check if a token hasn't been revoked

tokenByIndex(uint256).notice: Get a tokenId by it's index, where 0 <= index < total()

tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address,uint256).notice: Get the tokenId of a token using its position in the owner's list

tokenURI(uint256).notice: URI to query to get the token's metadata
